result.execSummary:
The defendant Detaris D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Restition of $7.50 owed to the Portage County District Attorney office.

Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use.  
   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
  Provide DNA sample, if not already done so.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Detaris D Smith in court, in custody with Attorney (Atty) Richard E. Bender. Prosecuting District Attorney (DA) Louis Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CF62 and 15CV322.
16CF62:
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1 - No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed Read In Count 2.
DA Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Bender concurs with joint agreement.  

BY THE COURT: **Determinate Sentence Prison**
16CF62 Count 1: 5 yrs prison
2 yrs Incarceration and 3 yrs Extended Supervision, concurrent with sentence currently serving, zero day credit
Eligible for Substance Abuse and Challenge programs.
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use.  
   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so.
Restition of $7.50 owed to the Portage County District Attorney office.
 Pay costs and surcharges.

15CV322:  Judgment is granted for the forfeiture of $1,240 as realized through the commission of a crime.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on February 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Atty Rodman Streicher appointed
Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Detaris D Smith not in court. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA states the status. BTC: Matter rescheduled and state will call the Public Defender office to get another attorney appointment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 10/17/16 - attempted, not known
Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2016 at 10:45 am.

David R. Knaapen appeared on behalf of Cass Cousins for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney David Paul Frank Templeton in court. Defendant Detaris D Smith appeared by phone from Fox Lake Correctional. 

2:20 pm  Court calls the case.  Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant responds.
Court advises Defendant he will be giving up his right to a speedy trial.
Defendant understands.
Court gives Defendant his rights.
Defendant responds.
Court questions Atty Knaapen.
Atty Knaapen responds.
Court questions Defendant re: why he doesn't want his atty to represent him anymore.
Defendant responds.
Court questions Atty Templeton.
Atty Templeton responds.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and knowingly given up his right to a speedy trial.
Court finds the Defendant is also requested new counsel.
Court grants adjournment and Atty Templeton the right to withdraw.
Atty Templeton to communicate with the Public Defender's Office so they can appoint another atty and he can transfer his file.
Pre-trial conference set for October 17, 2016 at 10:45 am
Jury trial is taken off for August 10, 2016.

2:27 pm  Court is in recess.
written statement from the defendant indicating that he disagrees with the trial strategy and would like another attorney appointed to his case
Hearing on August 8, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Attorney David Paul Frank Templeton in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:36 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Court states that there is an issue in regards to addressing the Trial set for August 10, 2016 for 2 days - defendant had filed a motion for a speedy trial and disposition.
Atty Templeton was recently assigned to the case and would request an adjournment.
Court states that the defendant would be requesting an new attorney.
Atty Templeton makes statements on the record.
Atty Templeton provides a handwritten statement from the defendant requesting a new attorney.
Court questions Atty Templeton regarding the Trial; Atty Templeton states that the defendant knows that the trial would be removed from
the calendar for August 10, 2016.

BY THE COURT:
State to contact the prison where the defendant is to have a video hearing on Monday, August 8, 2016 and see if the defendant could 
appear via the video.

  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Motion to Adjourn Trial filed by Atty David Templeton - fax only
Jury Trial - 12 Person set for 08/10/16 - attempted, not known

records.addlTxt: Pre-Trial Conference set for 06/20/16 - not deliverable as addressed
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Detaris D Smith in court with attorney David Paul Frank Templeton. Atty Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Cousins calls case, and states appearances.  Atty Cousins states he was brought here, as the Defendant is currently an inmate at Fox Lake.
Atty Templeton has received a copy of the criminal complaint, and has reviewed it with the Defendant.
Court finds Probable Cause, as referrenced in the Complaint. 
Court has a waiver of the Preliminary Hearing, and does review it with the Defendant.
Court finds the Defendant has freeley and voluntarily waived his right to a Preliminary Hearing.   Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.

Bond Continued  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Atty Templeton states the Defendant enters a Not Guilty plea on both counts.

Pretrial Conference is scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Bond has not been set, in light of the Defendants current conditions.  
Court will set bond at a $2,000.00, with no specific conditions.
Warrant is quashed.
Atty David Templeton appointed
